title: 'Disappointing Purchase: Trolley Wheel Bags with Poor Materials Quality'
body: I recently purchased a set of trolley wheel bags from Amazon, and I must say I am extremely disappointed with the poor materials quality. These bags seemed like a great deal at first, but their overall construction and durability leave a lot to be desired.  First and foremost, the wheels on these bags are extremely flimsy. They feel like they could fall off at any moment, and they wobble and squeak with the slightest movement. It's frustrating and inconvenient to have to constantly worry about the stability of the bags while maneuvering them around.  Furthermore, the handles on these bags are also made of subpar materials. They feel cheap and uncomfortable to hold, and I have doubts about their long-term durability. I fear that they might break or snap under normal usage conditions, leaving me with a useless bag.  The fabric used to construct the bags is also disappointing. It feels thin and lacks the sturdiness required for travel luggage. I expected a higher level of quality for the price I paid, but instead, I received bags that seem like they won't withstand even a few trips.  Additionally, the zippers on these bags are frustratingly unreliable. They often get stuck or snag on the fabric, making it a struggle to open or close the bags. This lack of attention to detail and functionality is a major drawback and adds to the overall disappointment.  To make matters worse, the customer service experience with the seller was less than satisfactory. Despite reaching out to them regarding my concerns and expressing my disappointment, I received no response. It's disheartening to see such a lack of responsibility and care from the seller.  In conclusion, I strongly advise against purchasing these trolley wheel bags due to their poor materials quality. They simply do not meet the standards expected for travel luggage. I regret my decision to buy them and will now have to look for a more reliable and durable alternative. Save yourself the frustration and disappointment and explore other options available on the market.
